subject: Sexual Health
title: Reading Body Language
description: A 60-second lesson on Reading Body Language.

hook.text: Words are only part of communication. Body language often reveals what someone cannot say aloud.

buildup.text: Leaning in, eye contact, and relaxed posture usually signal comfort and engagement.

discovery.text: Turning away, stiffening, avoiding eye contact, or pulling back are common signs of discomfort.

twist.text: Body language is not always reliable. Cultural differences and personal habits can cause misreadings.

climax.text: The safest approach combines reading body language with direct verbal check-ins to confirm comfort.

punchline.text: Watch the signals, but always ask the question.

quiz.question: Why is body language alone not enough to determine consent?
options: Everyone has the same body language
